cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 201 (Wednesday, December 6, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BUCK:H.R. 6617.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To require a report on payments provided to the Taliban andcongressional review of agreements signed with the Taliban.[Page H6209]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

cdata.text: This bill requires the Department of State to notify Congress when an entity receiving U.S.-provided funds enters into an agreement with the Taliban (the group controlling the government of Afghanistan). The State Department shall submit a report to Congress on the total amount and types of payments provided by such entities to the Taliban. The State Department shall also submit a report that includes a copy of each agreement between such entities and the Taliban between August 31, 2021, and the date of enactment.

bill.title: To require a report on payments provided to the Taliban and congressional review of agreements signed with the Taliban.

item.title: To require a report on payments provided to the Taliban and congressional review of agreements signed with the Taliban.
To require a report on payments provided to the Taliban and congressional review of agreements signed with the Taliban.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
